alert.note: Alert for Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 15 at 9:47PM EST until January 18 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills of 20 to 30 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, six or more inches of heavy snow possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern New Hampshire and west central and western Maine. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until midnight EST tonight. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Sunday night through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills this evening could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. On Monday, heavy snow may lead to difficult travel conditions. In additional increasing winds over the peaks and ridges combined with the wet and heavy nature of this snow may result in power disruptions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snowfall rates of greater than 1 inch per hour will make it difficult for road clearing operations to keep up. As a result, driving conditions may be worse than normal.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Somerset; Northern Franklin; Northern Oxford
